name: Novotel Wollongong Northbeach

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Cannot fault the location. Great spot right on the beach and walk to local park. Staff very friendly. There were two downsides to what could be a great review. First we chose to pay extra and selected a room with a view because it looked out at the beach. Would have been fantastic if we could see through the thick dirt on the glass. It appeared that previous guests had tried to rub some of the dirt off to see through (should have been a hint to the cleaner). Secondly there was a long wait for checkout which upset a number of guests standing around in a long line. This process does not match the status of the hotel star rating and cost for service to stay there.
reviews.title: Fantastic location disappointment with the room cleanliness

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We had a great stay here. The room was spacious and clean with a great, great view. The staff was accomodating and helpful. They made us toast in the middle of the night since we were still jet lagged even though it was not "supposed" to be available. Everything was clean and good. I thought this was a three star hotel and I think it is excellent as a three star although it is expensive compared to everything else in the area. We loved the staff and were very happy here. You are paying for the expansive views. I would not pay the rate without such a good view. They are not equipped for full service yet. We needed a toothbrush and they did not have anything. They sent us to a closed restaurant for dinner and they were short on knowledge of where to find flip flops or an internet cafe and little things like that. They charge $30 per day for the internet and even if you go to the "business center" it is about $10 for an hour, I think. But you are paying for the location and the friendly staff and we loved all that. The pool was lackluster and the fitness center is small but adequate. We were there at the start of Aussie winter so we didn't expect to use the pool but we did swim at the heated university pool and it was great.
reviews.title: Excellent Views, Great Location, Best Place in Wollongong

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My wife and I spent a weekend in this establishment to celebrate our anniversary. The location is spectacular as the hotel is sited along the beach. The hotel presentation is very Novotel .ie. bland and boring. The hotel claims to have a 41/2 star rating but i don't think it gets anywhere to this standard. I think the hotel management is trying to cut corners and thereby the service is really therefore below standard. Fore example I asked for a convenience pack i.e. toothbrush etc which I had forgotten to bring. I was told they ran out and would have packs available only after I had left. I find that this is remarkable for a luxury resort. We then asked for some bath robes. Again they did not have enough in stock so we did not get any. Then there was a conversation about where to have a good anniversary dinner. We were stunned by the lack of knowledge of the "concierge". Remarkably we were told the Outback Steakhouse was a good place for an anniversary dinner when the town of Wollongong has some really great restaurants.
reviews.title: Does not meet up to expectations

reviews.text: The rooms were bland and boring although spacious. They are pricey for where the hotel is. The restaurant has a great buffet dinner and serves a nice breakfast. Parking was free.
reviews.title: Nice location but expensive

reviews.text: My recommendation is that if you are going to spend this type of money on a weekend then a hotel in the Sydney city center is a better choice.
reviews.title: Lovely Views

reviews.title: Comfortable hotel with great beach views

reviews.title: Pleasantly surprised

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and I stayed at this hotel for my brothers wedding. Generally it was a very positve experience. The hotel itself is very nice with a massive foyer containing check in, bathrooms and a bar/cafe which is open all day serving snacks and brilliant (and potent!) cocktails.
reviews.title: Generally very good, a few little gripes...

reviews.text: The room was spacious with an enormous bathroom and separate bath and shower. Not much of a view but we could glipse the sea which is literally across the road. The higher rooms of course have a better view. Staff were very friendly and helpful, especially when we asked the check in early to prepare for the wedding.
reviews.title: Good locaiton, but with cockroaches

reviews.text: Small gripes: we were able to check in slightly early but we had to keep returning to check in to see if our room was ready. We had requested an early check in when we booked and were told it would be fine but when we got there the room wasn't ready so we had to rush to get ready.
reviews.title: Awesome location but left disappointed

reviews.text: Giant cockroach in the bathroom! Considering it was the only one I saw in Oz it's a bit ironic that it would be in quite a nice hotel!
reviews.title: Tired hotel ripe for a refurb

reviews.text: No mat on the bathroom floor. I slipped getting out of the shower and hurt myself quite badly.
reviews.title: Good location for the beach; good size rooms

reviews.text: We chose to stay at this hotel because it is supposedly the best in Wollongong and because it offered wheelchair accessible accommodation. We stayed for 3 unsatisfactory days and will not return. We have learned over the years that wheelchair access in hotels can be hit and miss and sadly a higher price is no guarantee that the facilities will meet the needs of the disabled traveller, so I guess we shouldn't have been surprised by the less than average room for a highly inflated price.
reviews.title: Disappointing

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: It is unfortunately the case that in most establishemnts the disabled traveller has no choice with regard to the standard of their accommodation. It's always a basic grade room, small, on a lower level, no views, etc. This one was spot on in that regard.
reviews.title: Novotel style in a great location

reviews.text: Our room was just about as far away from the lift as possible. This is a total pain for my hausband who finds pushing his wheelchair on carpet hard going and quite exhausting. They have made an effort with some features by lowering the light switches, providing lowered hanging space in the wardrobe and fitting a no hob shower and hand rails in the bathroom, but there is so much more that could be done to make the stay easier for someone who uses a wheelchair. A slight incline and small step at the bathroom door prevented my husband from getting in there independently and the placement of the furniture meant he couldn't move freely around the room . There was no door on the wardrobe and no easy chair or sofa, The air conditioning was ineffective and so with no balcony and not even a window that would open we were uncomfortably hot most of the time.
reviews.title: Great location, lousy decor

likes.disliked: — Run down and terrible value for money

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Even if we hadn't needed a disability friendly room we would have been dissappointed with our accommodation. What we had was no better than the average 3 star motel. The entire hotel needs refurbishing and the service they provide needs a shake up .
reviews.title: Due for refurbishment

likes.disliked: — bed, bath and breakfast (in that order)

reviews.text: Finally, especially considering the price we paid for our stay, I resent having to collect a trolley and transport my own luggage to and from the car. I never once saw a doorman, porter or concierge. I completed the "We value your comments" card, but of course I haven't had a reply.
reviews.title: Awful bed but otherwise nice hotel

description: Located just one and a half hours south of Sydney in the beautiful Illawarra, Novotel Wollongong Northbeach is one of New South Wales’s most popular getaway and business venues. Situated opposite North Wollongong beach, the 4 1/2 star hotel boasts 204 accommodation rooms and spa suites featuring stunning ocean and mountain views. The hotel caters for both the leisure and business traveller, offering a range of facilities and services including a swimming pool, spa, sauna, fitness centre, day spa, restaurant and two bars.
